Extending the Data Model

Lesson
objectives

* Distinguish between platform, application,
and customer entities

Distinguish between platform, application,
and customer typelists

* Create and edit an entity extension

* Create and edit a typelist extension

| Entity

object entity

¢ An entity is a definition of a business object used by the application, such as
Policy, User, ABContact, Producer, etc.

¢ Entities are defined in entity definition files (ETI) eti
* The ETI file describes the entity in XML format |
¢ There are two main types of entities:

* Base application entities
* Custom entities

| Base application entities Gi

¢ Abase application entity is an entity created by Guidewire and shipped as part of
the out-of-the-box configuration

* Guidewire creates base application entities on the application or the platform level

¢ Application entities are specific to
application

¢ Platform entities are common to all
Guidewire applications

Activity

| Custom entities Gi

eti

¢ Acustom entity is an entity
created by the customer

eti
EI

MedCase Ext LE « Acustom entity can be created

only on the application level and
it will be local inside that
application

| Entity extension G

Base application entities are read-only to prevent any conflicts during upgrade to
the next version of the Guidewire application

The concepts of an Entity extension allows customers to safely add new fields to
base application entities or to override certain attributes of existing base
application entity fields

The entity extension is defined in an ETX file

etx
To keep the maintenance of entities simple a base application entity E|
can have at most one ETX file

For fields that are added to a base application entity, Guidewire recommends that
the field name should end with _Ext

Extending base application entities
a) » The ETX file can be
created on the

eti — etx —_ . .
=| application level and it
MedCase_Ext Activity is local inside that
application

¢ An Internal Entity
Extension is created
by Guidewire to add
application specific
functionality to a
platform level entity

the application and
read-only

| Typelist G

¢ ATypelist is a fixed, Personinfo | Phone wAddresses | sank accounts
predefined list of values rr
(Typecodes) BankName”¢ RoutingNumber* > Account Number" Account Type" ¢
+ Values cannot be dynamically ‘ACME Credit Union 123-987 345678900 Checking = ¥
National Bank 745-222 232323566

added or removed during
runtime

Checking

[i BankAccountType.tti x |

¢ Defined value often used
to constrain user input

« When rendered in Ul, Y_typelist BankAccountType
typically appears as a typecode checking
dropdown list typecode savings

typecode other

| Typelist extension G

Base application Typelists are read-only to prevent any conflicts during upgrade to
the next version of the Guidewire application

The concepts of a Typelist extension allows customers to safely add new
Typecodes to base application Typelists

The Typelist extension is defined in a TTX file

To keep the maintenance of Typelists simple a base application Typelist can have
at most one TTX file

For Typecodes that are added to a base application Typelist, Guidewire
recommends that the code should end with _Ext

ttx

OD

| Typelists in the data model (1 of 2) Gi

ttx

¢ Follow similar principles as
entities
¢ Defined as XML files
¢ TTI, TIX and TTX files

* ...\Metadata\Typelist folder
read-only and contains
platform and base application
Typelists

D

ValidationLevel BuildingCode_Ext

ls te

ValidationLevel ValidationLevel

¢ ...\Extension\Typelist folder
contains everything customer
specific

ActivityStatus

| Typelists in the data model (2 of 2) Gi
B & =

ttx

¢ Kinds of Typelists:

tti + ValidationLevel is extendable

i) iw)

ValidationLevel BuildingCode_Ext * ActivityStatus is internal

* BuildingCode_Ext is custom

¢ Virtual Typelists don’t exist
as .tti files in Studio

ls te

ValidationLevel ValidationLevel

« Java code is generated

« A table is populated on the
database

¢ Virtual typelists behave like
other typelists

ValidationLevel  ActivityStatus

| Scenario G
Social media (part A)

An insurance company wants to implement a social media functionality to provide a

more personalized experience to customers.
ABContact

TaxID : ssn
EmailAddress1 : varchar(60)
EnrolledinSocialMedia_Ext : bit

Friendbook_Ext : varchar(100)
Chirp_E: rarchar(100)
AverageActivi xt : decimal(4,1)
LastSocialActi ;_Ext : datetime

Pexson: Wiliam Andy

information about the contact

Question G

,— — How many ETX files can a given entity have?

¢
¢
¢

ee

Answer G&G

,~ — How many ETX files can a given entity have?

¢
¢
¢

One ETX file per entity in most cases.

a

Question

_~ — What datatype do you enter for fields that will store....

¢
o A) String values?

B) Boolean values?

C) Numbers with decimal values?

ee

Answer

¢
¢
¢

a

_— — What datatype do you enter for fields that will store....

A) String values?
B) Boolean values?

c) Numbers with decimal values?

The correct responses are:
A) varchar

B) Bit

c) decimal

Question G

_— — Which datatypes require columnParam subelements?

¢
¢
¢

ee

Answer G&G

_~ — Which datatypes require columnParam subelements?

¢
¢
¢

varchar requires size and decimal which requires precision and scale

a

Question G

,— — Under what circumstances would you want to regenerate the Data
Pa Dictionary?

ee

Answer G&G

,~ — Under what circumstances would you want to regenerate the Data
Pa Dictionary?

You would want to regenerate the Data Dictionary whenever you extend the data
model and are concerned with data model validation beyond schema validation in the
Entity Editor. Regenerating the Data Dictionary also updates the dictionary files to
include the new fields (or entities) that you have created.

a

Question G

,~ — When does a Guidewire application actually modify the physical
Pa structure of the database?

ee

Answer G&G

,~ — When does a Guidewire application actually modify the physical
Pa structure of the database?

The physical structure of the database is modified only during start-up.

a

Question G

_- — Describe some of the differences between the files in the

KA ..\Metadata\Typelist\ and...\Extensions\Typelist\ folders.
7

ee

Answer G&G

_~ — Describe some of the differences between the files in the
¢ ..\Metadata\Typelist\ and ..\Extensions\Typelist\ folders.

Files under Metadata are read-only and are specific to the base configuration. You
cannot create Typelist files in the Metadata directory but can create Typelist files in the
Extensions directory. Only internal Typelist extension files (TIX) are in the Metadata
directory. Only external Typelist extension files (TTX) are in the Extensions directory.
Both directories contain Typelist (TT]) files.

Lesson
objectives * Distinguish between platform, application,
review and customer entities

+ Distinguish between platform, application,
and customer typelists

* Create and edit an entity extension

* Create and edit a typelist extension

| Student exercise
